name: clprompter
displayName: Bob Cozzi's CL Prompter for IBM i
description: Bob Cozzi's CL Prompter for IBM i CL commands

keybindings.when: editorTextFocus && (editorLangId == clle || editorLangId == clp || editorLangId == cl || editorLangId == bnd || editorLangId == cmd)

clPrompter.kwdColor.description: Parameter keyword color in prompter.  Use CSS color values like ##1a237e, blue, or rgb(34,170,34).

clPrompter.kwdValueColor.description: Parameter value color in prompter.  Use CSS color values like ##1a237e, blue, or rgb(34,170,34).

clPrompter.kwdColorAutoAdjust.description: Parameter keyword color Auto-adjust for best contrast in dark/light/high-contrast themes. If false, uses your color exactly as specified.

clPrompter.saveCmdXMLtoFile.description: Write prompted command XML to the cmdDefn.xml file. Useful for troubleshooting but not recommended for normal use.

clPrompter.savedCmdXMLFileLocation.description: Directory where cmdDefn.xml file is written. Use ${tmpdir} for system temp, ${userHome} for home directory, or an absolute path.

clPrompter.savePrompterHTMLtoFile.description: Save prompter HTML to clPrompt-<cmdName>.html file for diagnostic purposes. This file can be sent to support for troubleshooting issues with the prompter.

clPrompter.savedPrompterHTMLFileLocation.description: Directory where clPrompt-<cmdName>.html file is written. Use ${tmpdir} for system temp, ${userHome} for home directory, or an absolute path.

clPrompter.convertToUpperCase.description: Convert CL variables, operators (*BCAT, *TCAT, etc.), and built-in functions (%SUBST, %TRIM, etc.) to uppercase. When true, text like '&pickles *bcat %trim(x)' becomes '&PICKLES *BCAT %TRIM(x)'. When false, preserves original case. Applies to both the prompter display and final command output.

clPrompter.formatCase.description: Case conversion for CL source. *UPPER = uppercase, *LOWER = lowercase, *NONE = no change.

clPrompter.formatIndentComments.description: Indent comments. *YES = indent comments, *NO = leave at column 1.

clPrompter.formatLabelPosition.description: Position of the optional command label (1-10 characters followed by colon). Default: 2.

clPrompter.formatCmdPosition.description: Position where the CL command name starts. Must be at least 1 space after the label. Default: 14.

clPrompter.formatKwdPosition.description: Position where the first parameter/keyword starts. Use 0 for one space after command name. Default: 25.

clPrompter.formatContinuePosition.description: Position where continuation lines start. Normally 2 positions after formatKwdPosition. Default: 27.

clPrompter.formatRightMargin.description: Last position where data or continuation symbols (+ or -) may appear. Default: 72.
